general.title: Summarize Text
general.prompt:
Summarize the following text in {number} sentences, focusing on the key takeaways:

{text_to_summarize}

general.title: Explain Concept (Simple)
general.prompt: Explain the concept of {concept} using a simple analogy that a beginner can understand.

general.title: Explain Concept (Detailed)
general.prompt: Provide a comprehensive explanation of {concept}. Cover its definition, history, core principles, practical applications, and potential challenges or limitations.

general.title: Brainstorm Ideas
general.prompt: Generate a list of at least 10 creative and diverse ideas related to {topic}. Include both conventional and unconventional approaches.

general.title: Translate Text
general.prompt:
Translate the following text from {source_language} to {target_language}. Ensure the translation is accurate and maintains the original tone:

{text_to_translate}

general.title: Generate Questions
general.prompt:
Based on the text below, generate 5 thought-provoking questions that encourage critical thinking:

{context_text}

general.title: Rewrite Text (Tone)
general.prompt:
Rewrite the following passage to adopt a more {desired_tone} tone (e.g., formal, informal, enthusiastic, skeptical, persuasive):

{text_to_rewrite}

general.title: Pros and Cons Analysis
general.prompt: Analyze the primary advantages (pros) and disadvantages (cons) of adopting {strategy_or_technology}. Provide at least 3 points for each.

general.title: Create Analogy
general.prompt: Develop an original analogy to explain the complex process or concept of {complex_topic} in a relatable way.

general.title: Argument For/Against
general.prompt: Construct a concise argument {for_or_against} the following statement: {statement}. Support your argument with logical points.

general.title: Define Term
general.prompt: Provide a clear and concise definition for the term '{term}' in the context of {field_or_context}.

general.title: Check Grammar & Style
general.prompt:
Review the following text for grammatical errors, spelling mistakes, and awkward phrasing. Suggest improvements for clarity and flow:

{text_to_review}

productivity_work_mgmt.title: Prioritize To-Do List
productivity_work_mgmt.prompt: Help me create a prioritized to-do list based on these tasks: [list tasks]. Task A is due by [time], Task B requires [resource], and Task C impacts [stakeholder].

productivity_work_mgmt.title: Weekly Schedule Template
productivity_work_mgmt.prompt: Create a weekly schedule template that balances my work priorities, personal commitments, and health goals.

productivity_work_mgmt.title: Project Decision Matrix
productivity_work_mgmt.prompt: Design a decision matrix to help me evaluate which of these projects I should tackle first: [list projects with brief descriptions].

productivity_work_mgmt.title: Time-Blocking Strategy
productivity_work_mgmt.prompt: Suggest a time-blocking strategy for my workday that accounts for deep work, meetings, and administrative tasks.

productivity_work_mgmt.title: Weekly Review Template
productivity_work_mgmt.prompt: Generate a template for a weekly review process to evaluate my productivity and adjust my systems.

productivity_work_mgmt.title: Meeting Agenda Creation
productivity_work_mgmt.prompt: Create an agenda for a 60-minute [team/client] meeting focused on [topic]. Include time allocations for each section.

productivity_work_mgmt.title: Brainstorming Discussion Questions
productivity_work_mgmt.prompt: Generate a list of open-ended questions to stimulate discussion during our brainstorming session on [topic].

productivity_work_mgmt.title: Meeting Action Item Framework
productivity_work_mgmt.prompt: Design a framework for capturing action items and decisions during meetings to ensure follow-through.

productivity_work_mgmt.title: Difficult Conversation Facilitation
productivity_work_mgmt.prompt: Suggest strategies for facilitating a difficult conversation about [topic] during our upcoming team meeting.

productivity_work_mgmt.title: Pre-Meeting Checklist
productivity_work_mgmt.prompt: Create a pre-meeting checklist to ensure all participants come prepared and meetings are efficient.

analytics_data_insights.title: Identify KPIs
analytics_data_insights.prompt: Identify the top 5 KPIs for [industry/field] and explain their significance to business performance.

analytics_data_insights.title: SQL Metric Calculation
analytics_data_insights.prompt: Provide SQL queries to calculate [specific metrics] from a standard database schema.

analytics_data_insights.title: Customer Segmentation Model
analytics_data_insights.prompt: Design a customer segmentation model using [available data points]. What insights can we derive?

analytics_data_insights.title: Funnel Analysis
analytics_data_insights.prompt: Create a funnel analysis for [specific process]. Where are the major drop-off points?

analytics_data_insights.title: Predictive Model Development
analytics_data_insights.prompt: Develop a predictive model for [business outcome]. What variables are most influential?

analytics_data_insights.title: Effective Data Visualization Methods
analytics_data_insights.prompt: Suggest the most effective data visualization methods to represent [type of data] for [target audience].

analytics_data_insights.title: Monthly Performance Dashboard Template
analytics_data_insights.prompt: Create a template for a monthly performance dashboard that tracks [key metrics].

analytics_data_insights.title: Presenting Complex Data Insights
analytics_data_insights.prompt: Design a framework for presenting complex data insights to non-technical stakeholders.

analytics_data_insights.title: Narrate Data Trend Story
analytics_data_insights.prompt: Generate a script for narrating the story behind this trend in our [specific metric].

analytics_data_insights.title: Competitive Analysis Report Methodology
analytics_data_insights.prompt: Develop a methodology for a competitive analysis report in the [industry] sector.

writing_content_creation.title: Article Outline Generation
writing_content_creation.prompt: Generate an outline for a comprehensive article about [topic], focusing on [specific aspects].

writing_content_creation.title: Engaging Headline Generation
writing_content_creation.prompt: Create a list of 10 engaging headlines for an article about [topic] that would appeal to [target audience].

writing_content_creation.title: Blog Hook and Conclusion
writing_content_creation.prompt: Suggest a hook and conclusion for my blog post about [topic] that creates a cohesive narrative.

writing_content_creation.title: Blog Content Calendar
writing_content_creation.prompt: Develop a content calendar for a blog focusing on [industry/topic] with themes for the next three months.

writing_content_creation.title: Rewrite Paragraph for Engagement
writing_content_creation.prompt: Rewrite this paragraph to make it more engaging while maintaining its informational value: [paragraph].

writing_content_creation.title: LinkedIn Post Ideas
writing_content_creation.prompt: Generate 5 LinkedIn post ideas for sharing insights about [industry trend].

writing_content_creation.title: Twitter Promotion Series
writing_content_creation.prompt: Create a week's worth of Twitter posts promoting [product/service/event] without being repetitive.

writing_content_creation.title: Instagram Caption Suggestions
writing_content_creation.prompt: Suggest captions for Instagram that would accompany photos of [subject] and resonate with [target audience].

writing_content_creation.title: Social Media Storytelling Framework
writing_content_creation.prompt: Develop a storytelling framework for a series of social media posts about our company's journey.

writing_content_creation.title: Repurpose Content for Social Media
writing_content_creation.prompt: Create a template for repurposing long-form content into social media snippets.

email_communication.title: Newsletter Subject Lines
email_communication.prompt: Give me 10 subject lines for my [niche] newsletter.

email_communication.title: Promotional Email Body Copy
email_communication.prompt: Write the body copy for a promotional email with the subject line: [Your subject line].

email_communication.title: Follow-up Email Body Copy
email_communication.prompt: Write a follow-up email with the subject line: [Your subject line].

email_communication.title: Re-engage Inactive Subscribers
email_communication.prompt: How can I re-engage inactive subscribers on my email list?

email_communication.title: Email A/B Testing Strategy
email_communication.prompt: How can I use A/B testing to find out the best time to send my emails (and the best frequency)?

email_communication.title: Translate Email
email_communication.prompt: Translate this email into [language] please. Keep the tone [friendly] and write it like a native.

email_communication.title: Diplomatic Response to Colleague
email_communication.prompt: Draft a diplomatic response to this challenging email from a colleague: [email content].

email_communication.title: Constructive Feedback Template
email_communication.prompt: Create a template for providing constructive feedback to a team member about [specific issue].

email_communication.title: Negotiation Talking Points
email_communication.prompt: Generate talking points for a negotiation about [topic] where my primary goal is [objective].

email_communication.title: Professional Introduction Email
email_communication.prompt: Write a professional introduction email connecting two colleagues who could benefit from knowing each other.

email_communication.title: Communicate Project Delays
email_communication.prompt: Develop a framework for communicating project delays to stakeholders that maintains trust.

ux_ui_design.title: Generate UI Design Requirements
ux_ui_design.prompt: Generate examples of UI design requirements for a [mobile app].

ux_ui_design.title: Typography Style Guide
ux_ui_design.prompt: Generate a typography style guide for a [mobile application] in excel format.

ux_ui_design.title: Burger Menu UI Cases
ux_ui_design.prompt: What are the UI cases that need to be considered when designing a [burger menu].

ux_ui_design.title: Competitor Analysis from Reviews
ux_ui_design.prompt: Generate a sample report of a competitor's [product] by using online customer reviews. For the sake of this analysis, we will focus on product usability.

ux_ui_design.title: User Onboarding Flow Design
ux_ui_design.prompt: Design a user onboarding flow for a [fintech app]. What key steps and information should be included to build trust and engagement?

ux_ui_design.title: Suggest Micro-interactions
ux_ui_design.prompt: Suggest micro-interactions to enhance user engagement on a [type of website/app].

ux_ui_design.title: Heuristic Evaluation Framework
ux_ui_design.prompt: Create a framework for conducting a heuristic evaluation of a [type of digital product].

ux_ui_design.title: User Persona Templates
ux_ui_design.prompt: Develop persona templates for the primary users of a [type of service].

ux_ui_design.title: User Interview Questions (Pain Points)
ux_ui_design.prompt: Generate a list of questions for user interviews to better understand pain points in [specific process].

ux_ui_design.title: User Journey Map Template
ux_ui_design.prompt: Design a user journey map template for a customer purchasing [product/service].

customer_service.title: Draft Empathetic Response (Complaint)
customer_service.prompt: Draft an empathetic response to a customer complaint regarding {issue (e.g., late delivery, product defect)}. Acknowledge the problem, apologize, and outline the next step.

customer_service.title: Draft Response (Inquiry)
customer_service.prompt: Draft a clear and helpful response to a customer inquiry asking about {question (e.g., product features, return policy, how to use a feature)}.

customer_service.title: De-escalation Phrases
customer_service.prompt: Suggest 5 phrases that can be used in customer service to help de-escalate a situation with an upset customer.

customer_service.title: Handle Frustrated Customer (Damaged Product)
customer_service.prompt: Craft a script for handling a frustrated customer who received a damaged product. How can we turn this negative experience into a positive one?

customer_service.title: Troubleshooting Decision Tree
customer_service.prompt: Design a decision tree for troubleshooting common issues with [product/service]. What questions should we ask to quickly identify the problem?

customer_service.title: Customer Follow-up Template
customer_service.prompt: Create a template for following up with customers after resolving their issues. How can we ensure they're satisfied and encourage feedback?

customer_service.title: Proactive Customer Service Questions
customer_service.prompt: Develop a list of proactive questions to ask customers to prevent potential issues before they arise. What can we anticipate?

customer_service.title: Social Media Customer Service Responses
customer_service.prompt: Write a series of responses for social media customer service interactions. How can we maintain our brand voice while addressing concerns publicly?

customer_service.title: Customer Feedback Survey Design
customer_service.prompt: Design a customer feedback survey that provides actionable insights. What questions will help us improve our service?

customer_service.title: Analyze Customer Feedback Framework
customer_service.prompt: Create a framework for analyzing customer feedback and identifying patterns.

customer_service.title: Implement Customer Suggestions Strategy
customer_service.prompt: Develop a strategy for implementing customer suggestions and communicating changes back to them.

customer_service.title: Quarterly Customer Satisfaction Report
customer_service.prompt: Generate a template for a quarterly customer satisfaction report that highlights trends and opportunities.

customer_service.title: Customer Loyalty Program Structure
customer_service.prompt: Design a loyalty program structure that rewards customer engagement and feedback.

healthcare_medical.title: Differential Diagnosis Checklist
healthcare_medical.prompt: Generate a differential diagnosis checklist for a patient presenting with [symptoms].

healthcare_medical.title: Patient Education Handout
healthcare_medical.prompt: Create a patient education handout explaining [medical condition] in simple, non-technical language.

healthcare_medical.title: Medication Understanding Assessment Questions
healthcare_medical.prompt: Develop a list of questions to assess a patient's understanding of their newly prescribed medication.

healthcare_medical.title: Treatment Options Decision Support Tool
healthcare_medical.prompt: Design a decision support tool for evaluating treatment options for [medical condition] based on patient factors.

healthcare_medical.title: Patient Progress Monitoring Framework
healthcare_medical.prompt: Generate a framework for monitoring and documenting patient progress for [chronic condition].

healthcare_medical.title: Stay Updated with Medical Research
healthcare_medical.prompt: Suggest a structured approach to staying updated with the latest research in [medical specialty].

healthcare_medical.title: Present Complex Patient Case Template
healthcare_medical.prompt: Create a template for presenting a complex patient case during medical rounds.

healthcare_medical.title: Shift Handoff Checklist
healthcare_medical.prompt: Develop a checklist for effective handoffs between healthcare providers during shift changes.

healthcare_medical.title: Multidisciplinary Team Discussion Questions
healthcare_medical.prompt: Generate a list of questions to facilitate a multidisciplinary team discussion about a complex patient.

healthcare_medical.title: Quality Improvement Initiative Framework
healthcare_medical.prompt: Design a framework for a quality improvement initiative addressing [healthcare issue].

learning_education.title: Study Plan Creation
learning_education.prompt: Create a study plan for mastering [subject] in [timeframe], including milestones and resources.

learning_education.title: Generate Practice Questions
learning_education.prompt: Generate a set of practice questions that test understanding of [concept] at different levels of complexity.

learning_education.title: Effective Note-Taking Framework
learning_education.prompt: Develop a framework for taking effective notes while reading research papers about [topic].

learning_education.title: Glossary of Key Terms
learning_education.prompt: Create a glossary of key terms and concepts for beginners learning about [subject].

learning_education.title: Spaced Repetition Schedule Design
learning_education.prompt: Design a spaced repetition schedule for memorizing [content] for long-term retention.

learning_education.title: Active Learning Lesson Plan
learning_education.prompt: Generate a lesson plan for teaching [concept] to [audience] using active learning techniques.

learning_education.title: Assessment Rubric Creation
learning_education.prompt: Create a rubric for assessing [type of assignment] that provides constructive feedback.

learning_education.title: Critical Thinking Discussion Prompts
learning_education.prompt: Develop discussion prompts that encourage critical thinking about [topic].

learning_education.title: Peer Teaching Framework
learning_education.prompt: Design a framework for peer teaching that helps students reinforce their understanding of [subject].

learning_education.title: Explain Complex Concept (Analogies)
learning_education.prompt: Generate analogies and examples to explain [complex concept] to beginners.

personal_development.title: Create Habit Plan
personal_development.prompt:
Help me create a plan to build the habit of {desired_habit}. Outline steps including: 
1. Cue/Trigger (Making it obvious) 
2. Craving/Motivation (Making it attractive) 
3. Response/Action (Making it easy) 
4. Reward/Satisfaction (Making it satisfying). 
Suggest a specific starting frequency and duration.

personal_development.title: Set SMART Goal
personal_development.prompt: Help me formulate a SMART (Specific, Measurable, Achievable, Relevant, Time-bound) goal for my aspiration to {general_goal (e.g., exercise more, learn a skill, read more)}.

personal_development.title: Introspective Exercise Prompt
personal_development.prompt: Provide an introspective prompt or question to help someone reflect on their {area_of_reflection (e.g., core values, recent challenges, sources of happiness)}.

personal_development.title: Workout Plan Concept
personal_development.prompt: Outline a basic weekly workout plan concept for a beginner aiming for {fitness_goal (e.g., general fitness, weight loss, muscle gain)}, including types of exercises and frequency. Note: Consult a professional for personalized advice.

personal_development.title: Stress Management Technique
personal_development.prompt: Describe one technique for managing stress, such as {technique_name (e.g., deep breathing, mindfulness, progressive muscle relaxation)}. Explain how to practice it.

personal_development.title: Break Down Large Goal
personal_development.prompt: My main goal is to {large_goal_description (e.g., 'write a book', 'run a marathon', 'learn conversational Spanish')}. Break this down into 5-7 smaller, actionable steps or milestones I can focus on over the next {timeframe (e.g., month, quarter)}.

personal_development.title: Habit Tracking System Design
personal_development.prompt: Create a habit tracking system for building consistency with [habit], including accountability mechanisms.

personal_development.title: Monthly Personal Review Questions
personal_development.prompt: Generate a list of reflection questions for a monthly personal review of my progress toward [goal].

personal_development.title: Identify High-Impact Habits
personal_development.prompt: Design a framework for identifying which habits would most impact my goal of [goal].

personal_development.title: Overcome Habit Obstacles
personal_development.prompt: Develop a strategy for overcoming common obstacles to maintaining [habit].

personal_development.title: Daily Mindfulness Practices
personal_development.prompt: Suggest daily mindfulness practices that can be integrated into a busy schedule.

personal_development.title: Decision Framework (Yes/No)
personal_development.prompt: Create a decision framework for evaluating whether to say yes or no to new commitments.

personal_development.title: Stress Management Strategies
personal_development.prompt: Generate strategies for managing stress during particularly challenging periods at work.

personal_development.title: Personal Energy Management Plan
personal_development.prompt: Design a personal energy management plan that accounts for my natural productivity rhythms.

personal_development.title: Weekly Mental Health Check-in
personal_development.prompt: Develop a set of questions for a weekly mental health check-in with myself.

problem_solving_decision.title: Analyze Situation from Multiple Perspectives
problem_solving_decision.prompt: Help me analyze this situation from multiple perspectives: [describe situation].

problem_solving_decision.title: Identify and Test Assumptions
problem_solving_decision.prompt: Generate a list of assumptions I might be making about [issue] and how to test them.

problem_solving_decision.title: Pre-Mortem Analysis
problem_solving_decision.prompt: Create a pre-mortem analysis for my plan to [plan]. What could go wrong and how can I prevent it?

problem_solving_decision.title: Evaluate Information Source Credibility
problem_solving_decision.prompt: Develop a framework for evaluating the credibility of information sources about [topic].

problem_solving_decision.title: Solicit Diverse Viewpoints
problem_solving_decision.prompt: Design a process for soliciting diverse viewpoints before making a decision about [issue].

problem_solving_decision.title: Unconventional Problem Solving
problem_solving_decision.prompt: Generate unconventional approaches to solving [problem] by applying principles from [unrelated field].

problem_solving_decision.title: Generate Creative Constraints
problem_solving_decision.prompt: Create constraints that might lead to innovative solutions for [challenge].

problem_solving_decision.title: Reframe Problem with 'How Might We'
problem_solving_decision.prompt: Develop a series of 'how might we' questions to reframe [problem] in more actionable ways.

problem_solving_decision.title: Structured Brainstorming Process
problem_solving_decision.prompt: Suggest a structured brainstorming process (e.g., SCAMPER, Reverse Brainstorming) to generate solutions for [issue].

problem_solving_decision.title: Evaluate Creative Solutions Framework
problem_solving_decision.prompt: Design a framework for evaluating creative solutions based on feasibility, impact, and novelty.

research_information_synth.title: Research Paper Summary Template
research_information_synth.prompt: Create a template for summarizing research papers that captures key findings, methodology, and limitations.

research_information_synth.title: Organize Research Notes Framework
research_information_synth.prompt: Generate a framework for organizing notes and insights from multiple sources about [topic].

research_information_synth.title: Identify Literature Gaps Strategy
research_information_synth.prompt: Develop a strategy for identifying gaps in the existing literature on [subject].

research_information_synth.title: Maintain Updated Knowledge Base System
research_information_synth.prompt: Design a system for maintaining an updated knowledge base on rapidly evolving topics like [topic].

research_information_synth.title: Compare Conflicting Viewpoints Methodology
research_information_synth.prompt: Create a methodology for comparing conflicting viewpoints on [controversial topic].

research_information_synth.title: Identify Future Developments (Trends)
research_information_synth.prompt: Identify potential future developments in [industry] based on current trends and historical patterns.

research_information_synth.title: Assess Trend Longevity Questions
research_information_synth.prompt: Generate questions to assess whether a trend in [area] is likely to be short-lived or transformative.

research_information_synth.title: Monitor Early Signals of Change Framework
research_information_synth.prompt: Create a framework for monitoring early signals of change in [market/field].

research_information_synth.title: Separate Hype from Substance Methodology
research_information_synth.prompt: Develop a methodology for separating hype from substantive change when evaluating [technology/trend].

research_information_synth.title: Scenario Planning Exercise Design
research_information_synth.prompt: Design a scenario planning exercise for understanding potential futures for [industry/topic].

data_analysis.title: Generate Insights from Data
Explain Data Trend
data_analysis.prompt:
Explain the potential reasons behind the {upward/downward/specific} trend observed in {metric_name} between {start_date} and {end_date} based on this data:
{data_or_context}

data_analysis.title: Suggest Visualization
data_analysis.prompt: Given data showing {type_of_data (e.g., sales over time, category comparison)}, what is the most effective type of chart (e.g., bar, line, pie, scatter) to visualize this information and why?

data_analysis.title: Python Code for Plotting
data_analysis.prompt: Write Python code using {library (e.g., Matplotlib, Seaborn)} to create a {chart_type} visualizing the relationship between {x_axis_variable} and {y_axis_variable} from a pandas DataFrame named 'df'.

software_dev.title: Debug Python Code
software_dev.prompt:
Analyze the following Python code snippet and identify potential bugs or errors. Explain the issue and suggest a fix:

```python
{python_code_snippet}
```

software_dev.title: Optimize Algorithm
Generate Algorithm Concept
software_dev.prompt: Outline an algorithm in pseudocode to solve the problem of {problem_description (e.g., finding the shortest path in a graph, sorting a list efficiently)}.

software_dev.title: Explain Design Pattern
software_dev.prompt: Explain the {design_pattern_name (e.g., Singleton, Factory, Observer)} design pattern in software development. Describe its purpose, structure, and provide a simple conceptual example.

cybersecurity.title: Analyze Threat Scenario
cybersecurity.prompt: Describe the potential cybersecurity threats and attack vectors associated with {scenario (e.g., deploying a public-facing web application, employees using personal devices for work)}. Suggest mitigation strategies.

cybersecurity.title: Incident Response Steps
cybersecurity.prompt: Outline the key steps in an incident response plan for a suspected {type_of_incident (e.g., malware infection, data breach, phishing attack)}.

cybersecurity.title: Explain Security Concept
cybersecurity.prompt: Explain the cybersecurity concept of {concept (e.g., Zero Trust, Defense in Depth, SQL Injection, Cross-Site Scripting)} in simple terms, including its risks and common prevention methods.

cybersecurity.title: Explain XSS Vulnerability
cybersecurity.prompt: Explain what a Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerability is. Describe the difference between Stored XSS, Reflected XSS, and DOM-based XSS. Provide a simple example scenario for one type and suggest common mitigation techniques (e.g., input validation, output encoding).

cybersecurity.title: Password Security Best Practices
cybersecurity.prompt: List at least 5 essential best practices for creating and managing strong passwords for end-users. Explain why each practice is important.

cybersecurity.title: Phishing Email Analysis
cybersecurity.prompt:
Analyze the following (hypothetical) email text and identify common red flags that suggest it might be a phishing attempt:

Email Text:
`{hypothetical_phishing_email_text}`

cybersecurity.title: Basic Nmap Scan Command
cybersecurity.prompt: Provide a basic Nmap command to scan the host {target_ip_or_hostname} for its most common open TCP ports and attempt operating system detection. Explain what each flag in the command does.

cybersecurity.title: Incident Response - First Steps (Malware)
cybersecurity.prompt: A user reports suspected malware on their workstation. Outline the critical first 3-5 steps an incident responder should take to contain the situation and begin investigation (e.g., isolation, evidence preservation).

cybersecurity.title: Explain Principle of Least Privilege
cybersecurity.prompt: Explain the Principle of Least Privilege in cybersecurity. Why is it a fundamental security concept, and how can it be applied to user accounts and system processes?

cybersecurity.title: Identify Potential Firewall Block
cybersecurity.prompt: A user cannot access an internal web application at `http://{internal_ip}:{port}`. They can ping the server's IP address. Suggest how to investigate if a host-based or network firewall might be blocking the connection on the specific port.

cybersecurity.title: Hashing vs Encryption
cybersecurity.prompt: Explain the key differences between hashing and encryption in cryptography. Describe common use cases for each (e.g., password storage, data transmission).

project_management.title: Create Project Timeline Outline
project_management.prompt: Outline a high-level project timeline for {project_description}. Include key phases (e.g., planning, execution, testing, deployment) and estimated durations for each. Identify major milestones.

project_management.title: Prioritize Tasks
Assess Project Risks
project_management.prompt: Identify 3 potential risks for a project involving {project_context (e.g., developing a new mobile app, migrating a database)}. For each risk, suggest a possible mitigation strategy.

network_troubleshooting.title: Diagnose Connectivity Issue
network_troubleshooting.prompt: My computer ({operating_system}) cannot connect to the internet. Outline the steps I should take to diagnose the problem, starting from the physical layer up to the application layer. Include specific commands where applicable (e.g., ping, ipconfig/ifconfig, traceroute).

network_troubleshooting.title: Interpret Ping Results
network_troubleshooting.prompt:
Explain what the following ping results indicate about the network connection to {destination_ip_or_hostname}:

{ping_output}

network_troubleshooting.title: Identify Bottleneck (Traceroute)
network_troubleshooting.prompt:
Analyze the following traceroute output to {destination_ip_or_hostname}. Identify potential network bottlenecks or points of failure based on latency or packet loss:

{traceroute_output}

network_troubleshooting.title: Troubleshoot Slow Wi-Fi
network_troubleshooting.prompt: My Wi-Fi connection is very slow on my {device_type}. List common causes and troubleshooting steps, including checking signal strength, channel interference, router settings, and potential device issues.

network_troubleshooting.title: Check Open Ports
network_troubleshooting.prompt: Provide the command for {operating_system} (Linux/Windows/macOS) to check which network ports are currently open and listening on the local machine.

network_troubleshooting.title: DNS Resolution Problem
network_troubleshooting.prompt: I can ping IP addresses like 8.8.8.8, but I cannot access websites like google.com. What are the likely causes related to DNS, and how can I troubleshoot them on {operating_system}? Include commands like nslookup or dig.

network_troubleshooting.title: Firewall Rule Check
network_troubleshooting.prompt: Outline the process to check if a firewall ({firewall_type}, e.g., Windows Defender Firewall, iptables, ufw) might be blocking traffic for a specific application trying to reach {destination_ip}:{destination_port} on protocol {tcp_or_udp}.

osint.title: Find Social Media Profiles
osint.prompt: Suggest methods and tools (including specific search engine queries or specialized websites) to find social media profiles associated with the username '{username}' or the real name '{full_name}'.

osint.title: Website Technology Stack
osint.prompt: Describe how to identify the technology stack (CMS, web server, programming languages, frameworks, analytics tools) used by the website {website_url}.

osint.title: Domain/IP Information
osint.prompt: Outline the steps and tools (e.g., WHOIS lookup, reverse IP lookup, DNS enumeration tools) to gather information about the domain name {domain_name} or IP address {ip_address}.

osint.title: Search Engine Dorking (Google)
osint.prompt: Provide 5 Google Dorks (advanced search queries) to find specific types of information related to '{topic}', such as login pages, specific filetypes, directory listings, or publicly exposed documents.

osint.title: Image Metadata Analysis
osint.prompt: Explain how to potentially extract metadata (EXIF data) from an image file located at {image_url_or_path} and what kind of information (e.g., location, camera model, date/time) might be found.

osint.title: Company Information Gathering
osint.prompt: List public sources and techniques (e.g., company registries, financial filings, LinkedIn, news archives, job postings) to gather OSINT information about the company '{company_name}'.

osint.title: Email Address Verification
osint.prompt: Suggest methods (excluding sending an actual email) to attempt to verify if the email address '{email_address}' is likely valid or associated with a real person/service.

learning.title: Create Study Guide Outline
learning.prompt: Generate a study guide outline for the topic '{topic_name}'. Break it down into key subtopics, concepts, and potential areas for review.

learning.title: Generate Quiz Questions
learning.prompt: Create 5 multiple-choice quiz questions (with answers) covering the basics of {subject_or_topic}.

learning.title: Explain Complex Topic Simply
learning.prompt: Explain the complex topic of {topic_name} in a clear and simple way, suitable for someone encountering it for the first time. Use analogies if helpful.

language_learning.title: Build Vocabulary List
language_learning.prompt: Generate a list of 10 essential {target_language} vocabulary words related to {theme (e.g., travel, food, work)}, including their translations in {source_language} and a sample sentence for each.

language_learning.title: Correct Grammar
language_learning.prompt:
Please correct the grammar and suggest improvements for the following sentence(s) in {target_language}:

{sentence_or_paragraph_to_correct}

language_learning.title: Practice Conversation Scenario
language_learning.prompt: Simulate a simple conversation in {target_language} for the scenario: {scenario (e.g., ordering food in a restaurant, asking for directions, introducing yourself)}. Provide both sides of the dialogue.

exam_prep.title: Generate Practice Problems (Math)
exam_prep.prompt: Create 3 practice math problems similar to those found on the {standardized_test_name (e.g., SAT, GRE)} focusing on {math_topic (e.g., algebra, geometry, probability)}. Include solutions.

exam_prep.title: Generate Verbal Reasoning Question
exam_prep.prompt: Generate a verbal reasoning practice question (e.g., sentence completion, reading comprehension passage with questions) in the style of the {standardized_test_name}.

exam_prep.title: Outline Essay Structure (Test)
exam_prep.prompt: Provide a recommended essay structure for tackling an argumentative essay prompt typically found in the {standardized_test_name} writing section.

storytelling.title: Generate Plot Ideas
storytelling.prompt: Generate 3 distinct plot ideas for a story in the {genre (e.g., sci-fi, fantasy, mystery)} genre involving a {character_archetype} who must {objective}.

storytelling.title: Create Character Profile
storytelling.prompt: Create a brief character profile for a {role (e.g., protagonist, antagonist, mentor)} in a {genre} story. Include name, appearance, key personality traits, motivation, and a flaw.

storytelling.title: Write Dialogue Scene
storytelling.prompt: Write a short dialogue scene between two characters, {Character A} and {Character B}, where they are discussing {topic_of_conversation} and have conflicting opinions.

storytelling.title: Interactive Roleplay Starter
storytelling.prompt: Start an interactive roleplaying scenario. You are {character_description}. I am {my_character_description}. The setting is {setting_description}. Begin the scene.

art_design.title: Conceptualize Art Theme
art_design.prompt: Brainstorm 5 themes or concepts for a series of artworks exploring {subject (e.g., nature, technology, emotion)} in a {style (e.g., abstract, surreal, realistic)} style.

art_design.title: Generate Design Ideas
art_design.prompt: Generate 3 distinct design ideas for a {type_of_design (e.g., logo, website homepage, book cover)} for a brand/product related to {industry_or_topic}. Describe the visual elements and mood.

art_design.title: Describe Color Palette
art_design.prompt: Suggest a color palette (provide 3-5 color hex codes or names) that evokes a feeling of {mood_or_concept (e.g., calmness, energy, luxury)} and explain the reasoning.

business_strategy.title: Outline Business Plan Section
business_strategy.prompt: Outline the key components to include in the '{section_name (e.g., Market Analysis, Marketing and Sales Strategy, Financial Projections)}' section of a business plan for a company offering {product_or_service}.

business_strategy.title: Develop Market Entry Strategy Ideas
business_strategy.prompt: Suggest 3 potential market entry strategies for introducing {product_or_service} into the {target_market}. Briefly describe the pros and cons of each.

business_strategy.title: SWOT Analysis Points
business_strategy.prompt: Generate potential points for a SWOT analysis (Strengths, Weaknesses, Opportunities, Threats) for a business operating in the {industry} sector.

content_creation.title: Generate Blog Post Ideas
content_creation.prompt: Generate 5 blog post ideas targeting {target_audience} related to the topic of {main_topic}.

content_creation.title: Write Ad Copy Variation
content_creation.prompt: Write 3 variations of short ad copy (e.g., for Google Ads, Facebook Ads) promoting {product/service} and highlighting its main benefit: {key_benefit}.

content_creation.title: Create Social Media Caption
content_creation.prompt: Draft a social media caption for {platform (e.g., Instagram, LinkedIn)} to accompany an image/video about {content_subject}. Include relevant hashtags.

marketing.title: Social Media Post
marketing.prompt: Draft 3 distinct social media posts for {platform (e.g., Twitter, LinkedIn, Instagram)} to announce the launch of {product/feature}. Tailor the tone and length for each platform.

marketing.title: Headline Ideas
marketing.prompt: Generate 10 catchy and benefit-driven headline ideas for a landing page advertising {product/service}.

marketing.title: Value Proposition
marketing.prompt: Articulate a clear and concise value proposition for {product/service} targeting {target_audience}.

marketing.title: Target Audience Persona
marketing.prompt: Create a brief persona description for the ideal customer of {product/service}, including demographics, needs, pain points, and goals.

science_research.title: Explore Hypothesis
science_research.prompt: Given the observation {observation}, formulate a testable scientific hypothesis to explain it. Suggest a basic experimental design concept to test this hypothesis.

science_research.title: Summarize Academic Paper Abstract
science_research.prompt:
Summarize the key findings and conclusions from the following academic paper abstract:

{paste_abstract_text}

science_research.title: Analyze Sustainability Practice Impact
science_research.prompt: Discuss the potential positive and negative environmental impacts of implementing {sustainability_practice (e.g., switching to renewable energy, reducing water usage, implementing a recycling program)} in the context of {industry_or_setting}.

games_puzzles.title: Generate Trivia Questions
games_puzzles.prompt: Create 5 trivia questions (with answers) about the topic: {trivia_topic}.

games_puzzles.title: Design Escape Room Puzzle Concept
games_puzzles.prompt: Outline a concept for a puzzle to be used in an escape room with the theme '{room_theme}'. Describe the puzzle type (e.g., logic, pattern, physical) and how players would solve it.

games_puzzles.title: Create Riddle
games_puzzles.prompt: Write an original riddle where the answer is '{the_answer}'.

travel_itinerary.title: Plan a {N}-Day Trip
travel_itinerary.prompt: Create a suggested {N}-day itinerary for a trip to {city_or_region}, focusing on {type_of_interest (e.g., historical sites, nature, food, relaxation)}. Include potential activities, sights, and logistical considerations (e.g., travel time between locations) for each day. Assume a budget level of {budget_level (e.g., budget, mid-range, luxury)}.

travel_itinerary.title: Activities for Family/Solo/Couple
travel_itinerary.prompt: Suggest 5 suitable activities or attractions in {location} for a {traveler_type (e.g., family with young children, solo traveler, couple seeking romance)}.

travel_itinerary.title: Packing List
travel_itinerary.prompt: Generate a suggested packing list for a {duration} trip to {destination} during {season_or_month}, considering the typical weather and planned activities like {activity_1}, {activity_2}.

travel_itinerary.title: Restaurant Recommendations
travel_itinerary.prompt: Recommend 3 restaurants in {city} that offer authentic {cuisine_type} experiences, catering to different price points (budget, mid-range, fine dining).

travel_itinerary.title: Transportation Options
travel_itinerary.prompt: Outline the main transportation options for getting around {city_or_region}, including public transport (mention types like metro, bus, tram), taxis/rideshares, and walking/cycling possibilities. Mention typical costs or pass options if known.

travel_itinerary.title: Day Trip from City
travel_itinerary.prompt: Suggest a feasible and interesting day trip destination from {base_city}. Include how to get there, key attractions at the destination, and estimated travel time.

travel_itinerary.title: Cultural Etiquette Tips
travel_itinerary.prompt: Provide essential cultural etiquette tips for a traveler visiting {country_or_region}, focusing on greetings, dining, tipping, and general social interactions.

advanced_techniques.title: Chain-of-Thought (CoT) Example
advanced_techniques.prompt:
Solve the following reasoning problem by showing your step-by-step thinking process (Chain-of-Thought):
Problem: {reasoning_problem_description}

advanced_techniques.title: Tree-of-Thought (ToT) Exploration Idea
advanced_techniques.prompt: Outline how you might use a Tree-of-Thought approach to explore potential solutions or outcomes for the complex problem: {complex_problem_description}. Describe the branching possibilities.

advanced_techniques.title: Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) Scenario
advanced_techniques.prompt: Imagine you need to answer the question '{complex_question_requiring_external_data}' using RAG. Describe the steps involved: 1. How would you retrieve relevant information? 2. How would you combine the retrieved information with your generative capabilities to formulate the answer?

advanced_techniques.title: Technical Documentation Generation (SysAdmin/Support)
advanced_techniques.prompt: Role: You are an expert technical writer specializing in creating detailed guides for system administrators and technical support engineers. Objective: Generate a comprehensive technical guide in Markdown format for the internal process specified below. The guide must serve as both a step-by-step tutorial for using the process and a troubleshooting guide for common issues. Target Audience: System Administrators and Technical Support Engineers. A high level of technical knowledge is expected from the reader. Tone and Style: Highly technical, precise, clear, and concise. Use appropriate technical terminology. Output Format: Markdown (.md). Mandatory Structure (Strictly follow these sections and their order): **Introduction:** Briefly mention what the document will cover.  **Installation (if applicable):**  Provide detailed, step-by-step instructions for the initial installation/setup required to use the process. Include prerequisites (software, hardware, configurations, permissions). Include specific commands or code snippets necessary for installation, properly formatted in Markdown code blocks. If there is no distinct installation step for this process, omit this section and mention in the Introduction that no installation is required. **Configuration (if applicable):    *   Provide detailed, step-by-step instructions for configuring the process after installation or for adjusting its parameters.

coding.title: Python Function with Error Handling
coding.prompt: Write a well-commented Python function named `calculate_division` that takes two numbers, `numerator` and `denominator`, as input. It should return the result of the division. Implement robust error handling for potential `ZeroDivisionError` and `TypeError` (if inputs are not numbers), returning `None` or raising a custom exception in case of errors.

coding.title: JavaScript DOM Manipulation
coding.prompt: Write JavaScript code to select an HTML element with the ID `user-greeting`. If the element exists, change its text content to 'Welcome back, {username}!' where `{username}` is a variable holding the user's name. If the element doesn't exist, log an error to the console.

coding.title: Explain Algorithm (e.g., Binary Search)
coding.prompt: Explain the Binary Search algorithm step-by-step. Describe its prerequisites (sorted array), time complexity (Big O notation), and provide pseudocode or a simple code example in {preferred_language (e.g., Python, Java)}.

coding.title: Refactor Code for Readability
Generate Unit Test Cases
coding.prompt:
Given the following {language} function signature and description, generate a list of at least 5 distinct unit test cases (including edge cases, valid inputs, and invalid inputs) that should be tested.

Function: `{function_signature}`
Description: `{function_description}`

coding.title: SQL Query for Join
coding.prompt: Write an SQL query to retrieve the `order_id` from the `Orders` table and the corresponding `customer_name` from the `Customers` table. The tables are linked by `customer_id`. Only include orders placed after `{date}`.

coding.title: REST API Endpoint Design
coding.prompt: Design a REST API endpoint (including HTTP method, URL path, potential request body parameters, and expected success/error responses) for the action: {action_description (e.g., 'creating a new user', 'retrieving a specific product by ID', 'updating an order status')}.

coding.title: Debug Common Error Message
coding.prompt: Explain the common causes and potential solutions for the following error message in {language_or_framework}: '{error_message_text}'

coding.title: Autonomous Code Testing & Improvement Agent
coding.prompt:
**Role:** Assume the role of a **Meticulous Autonomous Code Analysis Agent**. Your primary functions are to test code against provided specifications, identify deviations or areas for enhancement, and iteratively refine the code.

**Objective:** Systematically analyze, simulate testing, identify issues, and generate improved versions of an initial code snippet until it satisfies all requirements and passes all test cases, or until a specified iteration limit is reached.

**Inputs:**

1.  **Programming Language:** `{LANGUAGE}`
2.  **Initial Code Snippet:**
    ``` {LANGUAGE}
    {INITIAL_CODE}
    ```
3.  **Requirements Description:**
    `{REQUIREMENTS}`
4.  **Test Cases:** (Provided as Input -> Expected Output pairs)
    `{TEST_CASES}`
    *   Example Format:
        *   Test 1: Input: `[Input Value/Args]`, Expected Output: `[Expected Result]`
        *   Test 2: Input: `[Input Value/Args]`, Expected Output: `[Expected Result]`
        *   ...
5.  **Maximum Iterations:** `{MAX_ITERATIONS}`

**Process:**

1.  **Initial Analysis:**
    *   Briefly confirm understanding of the code's purpose based on the requirements.
    *   Acknowledge the language and test cases provided.
2.  **Iterative Refinement Loop (Repeat up to `MAX_ITERATIONS` times):**
    *   **A. Simulate Test Execution:**
        *   For *each* test case provided, perform a step-by-step simulated execution of the *current* code version.
        *   **Crucially, document the predicted output for each test case based on your simulation.**
        *   Compare your predicted output against the expected output.
        *   Determine if the test case result is `Pass` or `Fail`. If `Fail`, briefly state the discrepancy.
    *   **B. Identify Issues & Prioritize:**
        *   Based on the simulated test results, list all identified issues. Prioritize them as follows:
            1.  **Correctness Errors:** Code produces incorrect output for specified test cases or clearly violates requirements.
            2.  **Potential Edge Case Failures:** Identify inputs not covered by tests where the code might fail or behave unexpectedly.
            3.  **Inefficiencies:** Suggest improvements for performance (time/space complexity) if obvious.
            4.  **Readability/Style:** Note violations of common {LANGUAGE} style conventions or areas where clarity can be improved.
        *   If all tests passed *and* no critical issues (like unhandled edge cases) are identified, proceed to **Termination**.
    *   **C. Generate Revised Code & Explain:**
        *   If issues were identified, generate a *new, complete version* of the code snippet addressing the *highest priority* issues first.
        *   Provide a clear, concise explanation linking each change directly to the issue(s) it resolves. Focus on *why* the change was made.
    *   **D. Check Iteration Limit:** If the maximum number of iterations has been reached, proceed to **Termination**.
3.  **Termination:**
    *   State the final status: `Complete` (all tests passed, no critical issues) or `Stopped - Max Iterations Reached`.
    *   Provide the final version of the code.
    *   If stopped due to iterations, briefly list any outstanding high-priority issues.

**Output Format:**

**Initial Analysis:**
*   **Understood Goal:** [Brief confirmation, e.g., "Code aims to calculate factorial"]
*   **Language:** {LANGUAGE}
*   **Test Cases Acknowledged:** [Number]

---

**Iteration: [1 to MAX_ITERATIONS]**
*   **Status:** [Testing / Improving]
*   **Simulated Test Results:**
    *   Test Case 1: Input: `[Input]` -> Predicted: `[Output]` | Expected: `[Output]` | Result: [Pass/Fail - Brief reason if Fail]
    *   Test Case 2: Input: `[Input]` -> Predicted: `[Output]` | Expected: `[Output]` | Result: [Pass/Fail - Brief reason if Fail]
    *   ...
*   **Issues Identified (Prioritized):**
    1.  [Highest priority issue description]
    2.  [Next priority issue description]
    *   ... (List only if issues exist)
*   **Revised Code:** (Only if issues were identified and changes made)
    ``` {LANGUAGE}
    [Revised code snippet]
    ```
*   **Explanation of Changes:** (Only if Revised Code is provided)
    *   [Change 1: Explain what was changed and why, linking to an issue #]
    *   [Change 2: Explain what was changed and why, linking to an issue #]
    *   ...

---

**(Repeat Iteration Block)**

---

**Final Output:**
*   **Final Status:** [Complete / Stopped - Max Iterations Reached]
*   **Final Code:**
    ``` {LANGUAGE}
    [Final code snippet]
    ```
*   **Outstanding Issues (If Status is Stopped):**
    *   [Brief description of unresolved high-priority issues]

**Constraints & Guidance:**

*   **Simulation Only:** You *cannot* execute code. All testing is based on your step-by-step simulation and analysis.
*   **Show Your Work:** Clearly document predicted outputs during simulation.
*   **Clarity and Conciseness:** Explain changes and issues directly and avoid unnecessary verbosity.
*   **Focus on Improvement:** Address identified issues systematically based on priority.
*   **Adhere to Language Best Practices:** Consider standard {LANGUAGE} conventions when suggesting improvements.
*   **No External Tools:** Operate solely based on the provided inputs.
*   **Do Not Ask Questions:** Proceed based on the information given unless a critical ambiguity *prevents* any analysis.

**Now, begin with the Initial Analysis.**

regex_creation.title: Generate Regex from Requirements
regex_creation.prompt:
Convert the following natural language requirements into a regex string:

- The string must have 2-63 characters.
- It should be alphanumeric and may include hyphens (-).
- It must start and end with an alphanumeric character.

Provide only the regex string.

regex_creation.title: Explain the Regex
regex_creation.prompt: Provide a detailed explanation of the generated regex string. Break down each component of the regex and explain how it meets the given requirements. Include a few examples demonstrating valid and invalid strings.

regex_creation.title: Python Code for Regex Demonstration
regex_creation.prompt: Write Python code that uses the re module to demonstrate the use of the generated regex. The code should test several example strings (both valid and invalid) and print whether each string matches the regex.

interactive_web_dev.title: Generate UI Component (React, Vue, etc.)
interactive_web_dev.prompt: Generate code for a `{component_name}` component in `{framework (e.g., React, Vue)}` using `{language (e.g., TypeScript)}`. The component should `{brief_functionality_description}`. Use `{styling_library (e.g., Tailwind CSS, Styled Components)}` for styling. Ensure it is `{key_characteristic (e.g., accessible, responsive)}`.

interactive_web_dev.title: Create Complex Form with Validation
interactive_web_dev.prompt: Create a form component in `{framework}` for `{form_purpose}`. The form must include the following fields: `{list_of_fields_and_types}`. Implement real-time validation for each field using `{validation_library (e.g., Zod, Yup)}`. On submit, the validated data should be sent to a function named `handleFormSubmit`.

interactive_web_dev.title: Implement State Management Logic
interactive_web_dev.prompt: In my `{framework}` application, I need to manage `{type_of_state (e.g., user authentication state)}`. Show me an approach using `{state_management_library (e.g., Redux Toolkit, Zustand, Pinia)}`. Generate the code for the store/slice and an example of how to access and modify the state from a component.

interactive_web_dev.title: Create Custom Hook for Data Fetching (React)
interactive_web_dev.prompt: Write a custom hook in `React` named `useFetchData` that fetches data from a given URL. The hook must manage `loading`, `error`, and `data` states. Use `{method (e.g., Axios, Fetch API)}` for the request. Data should not be re-fetched on every render. Also, add a `refetch` function that can be called manually.

interactive_web_dev.title: Generate REST API Endpoints (CRUD)
interactive_web_dev.prompt: Generate a controller in `{backend_framework (e.g., Node.js with Express, FastAPI)}` for the `{resource_name}` resource. Implement the complete CRUD operations (GET, POST, PUT, DELETE). For the POST operation, validate the request body to ensure it includes `{required_fields}`. Use a `{auth_type (e.g., JWT)}` middleware to protect the secure routes.

interactive_web_dev.title: Define Database Schema/Model
interactive_web_dev.prompt: Write a schema/model for `{model_name (e.g., User, Product)}` using `{ORM/ODM (e.g., Mongoose, Prisma, SQLAlchemy)}`. The model must have the following fields: `{list_of_fields_with_types_and_constraints}`.

interactive_web_dev.title: Write Complex Database Query
interactive_web_dev.prompt: Using `{ORM/Library (e.g., Prisma, Mongoose)}` and the `{model_name}` model, write an async function that `{complex_query_description (e.g., finds all active users who registered in the last month and populates their orders)}`.

interactive_web_dev.title: Refactor Component for Performance/Readability
interactive_web_dev.prompt:
Analyze the following `{framework}` component and suggest how it can be refactored to be more `{objective (e.g., performant, readable, reusable)}`. Explain the proposed changes.

```javascript
{component_code_to_refactor}
```

interactive_web_dev.title: Write Unit Tests for a Component/Function
interactive_web_dev.prompt:
Write unit tests for the following function/component `{function_or_component_name}` using `{testing_framework (e.g., Jest, Vitest)}`. Make sure to cover the following scenarios: `{scenario_1, scenario_2, edge_cases}`.

```javascript
{code_to_test}
```

interactive_web_dev.title: Debug Frontend Code
interactive_web_dev.prompt:
My `{framework}` code below is supposed to `{what_it_should_do}`, but instead it `{what_it_does_wrong}`. Can you identify the problem, explain why it's happening, and how I can fix it?

```javascript
{problematic_code}
```

personas.title: The Pragmatic Product Manager
personas.prompt:
Act as a Pragmatic Product Manager. Your expertise lies in bridging user needs, business goals, and technical feasibility. You are a master of prioritization, user stories, and creating clear specifications for developers.

My idea/feature is: `{my_idea_or_feature}`

Your task is to:
1.  Translate my idea into actionable developer tasks.
2.  Write clear User Stories in the format: 'As a [user], I want to [action], so that [benefit].'
3.  Propose a prioritization of features using the MoSCoW (Must-have, Should-have, Could-have, Won't-have) framework to define a Minimum Viable Product (MVP).
4.  Briefly outline potential user flows, edge cases, and acceptance criteria for the core features.

Focus relentlessly on clarity, feasibility, and defining the simplest version that delivers value.

personas.title: The Direct-Response Copywriter
personas.prompt:
Act as a Direct-Response Copywriter. Your goal is not to be poetic; it is to write persuasive copy that drives a specific action (e.g., buy, sign up, click).

I need copy for: `{product_or_purpose (e.g., a landing page for a productivity app, a promotional email)}`
The target audience is: `{target_audience}`
The key benefit is: `{key_benefit}`

Your task is to write compelling copy that includes:
1.  An attention-grabbing headline or hook.
2.  A clear focus on benefits for the user, not just features of the product.
3.  Language that directly addresses the audience's pain points and objections.
4.  A strong, unambiguous Call-to-Action (CTA).

Use clear, concise language and short sentences.

personas.title: The Skeptical Venture Capitalist (VC)
personas.prompt:
Act as a skeptical, experienced Venture Capitalist. Your function is to ruthlessly evaluate the viability and scalability of a business idea by asking tough, probing questions. Your goal is to identify weaknesses before time and money are invested.

My business idea is: `{my_business_idea}`

Your task is to 'pressure test' my idea by asking critical questions covering:
- **Market:** What is the TAM/SAM/SOM? Is this a vitamin or a painkiller?
- **Product-Market Fit:** What is the evidence that people actually want this?
- **Business Model:** How does this make money? What are the key metrics (CAC, LTV)?
- **Competition:** What is the competitive advantage or 'moat'? Why will this win?
- **Scalability:** What are the key obstacles to scaling this to 100x its current size?

Maintain a direct, critical, and objective tone. Do not provide solutions, only challenging questions.

personas.title: The Data Storyteller
personas.prompt:
Act as a Data Storyteller. Your expertise is in translating raw data, numbers, and statistics into a compelling and understandable narrative for a non-technical audience. Your goal is to find and explain the 'so what?' behind the data.

Here is the data I have: `{paste_or_describe_data (e.g., 'Weekly user sign-ups have gone from 100 to 500 in 3 months. User retention is at 40%.')}`
The audience for this story is: `{audience (e.g., marketing team, CEO)}`

Your task is to:
1.  Identify the single most important insight or trend in the data.
2.  Structure your explanation as a story: a setup (context), a confrontation (the key finding), and a resolution (the conclusion or recommendation).
3.  Suggest the most effective type of chart (e.g., bar, line, pie) to visually support the narrative.
4.  Write the narrative using clear, jargon-free language.

personas.title: The Socratic Adversary / Devil's Advocate
personas.prompt:
Act as a Socratic Adversary or Devil's Advocate. Your purpose is not to provide answers, but to force deeper thinking by challenging assumptions and using logical inquiry. You must not accept any premise at face value.

My argument/belief/decision is: `{my_argument_or_belief}`

Your task is to rigorously challenge my position by:
- Using a chain of 'why?' questions to probe the underlying principles.
- Identifying potential logical fallacies, cognitive biases, or inconsistencies in my argument.
- Presenting counter-arguments and plausible alternative scenarios.
- Questioning the definitions of the key terms I use.

Maintain a neutral, inquisitive, and challenging tone throughout.

personas.title: The Systems Architect
personas.prompt:
Act as a senior Systems Architect. Your expertise is in designing the high-level technical foundation for software applications, focusing on scalability, security, performance, and cost.

I want to build: `{application_description (e.g., 'a social media app for hikers with photo sharing and location tracking')}`

Your task is to outline a high-level backend architecture plan. You should:
1.  Propose a set of core components (e.g., Database, API Gateway, Authentication Service, File Storage).
2.  Briefly describe the data flow between these components.
3.  Discuss key trade-offs (e.g., SQL vs. NoSQL, Monolith vs. Microservices) and recommend a starting point.
4.  Identify the most critical non-functional requirements to consider (e.g., 'low-latency for tracking', 'high-availability for photo uploads').

Your output should be a high-level technical plan, not code.

personas.title: The Metaphor Maker / Analogist
personas.prompt:
Act as a Metaphor Maker. Your expertise is in explaining highly complex or abstract topics by creating simple, powerful, and memorable analogies.

I need to understand the following complex topic: `{complex_topic (e.g., blockchain, quantum entanglement, machine learning)}`

Your task is to:
1.  Break down the topic into its most fundamental principles.
2.  Create an original, easy-to-understand analogy using a familiar, everyday concept.
3.  Explain the complex topic step-by-step *in terms of* your analogy.
4.  Clearly state the limitations of the analogy to prevent misunderstanding.

personas.title: The Atomic Habits Architect
personas.prompt:
Act as an Atomic Habits Architect, inspired by James Clear. Your expertise is in behavioral science and building systems for personal change through small, consistent actions.

I want to build the habit of: `{habit_to_build}`
I want to break the habit of: `{habit_to_break}`

Your task is to create a practical system for me by applying the Four Laws of Behavior Change:
1.  **Make it Obvious (Cue):** How can I design my environment or use habit stacking to trigger the good habit?
2.  **Make it Attractive (Craving):** How can I link the habit to something I enjoy?
3.  **Make it Easy (Response):** How can I scale it down to a 'two-minute' version and reduce friction?
4.  **Make it Satisfying (Reward):** How can I give myself an immediate reward for performing the habit?

For breaking the bad habit, apply the inverse of these laws.

personas.title: The Stoic Guide
personas.prompt:
Act as a Stoic Guide, drawing wisdom from Marcus Aurelius, Seneca, and Epictetus. Your goal is to help me build mental resilience and find tranquility by focusing on what is within my control.

I am currently facing this challenge/feeling this emotion: `{my_challenge_or_feeling}`

Your task is to guide my thinking using Stoic principles:
- First, help me apply the **Dichotomy of Control**: Which aspects of this situation can I control, and which can I not?
- Next, guide me to reframe the obstacle as an opportunity for virtue (courage, wisdom, justice).
- Offer a **premeditatio malorum** (negative visualization) exercise related to my challenge.
- Conclude by offering a quote or principle from a Stoic philosopher that I can reflect on.

Maintain a calm, wise, and grounding tone.

personas.title: The Financial Literacy Coach
personas.prompt:
Act as a Financial Literacy Coach. Your expertise is in demystifying personal finance and empowering people with foundational knowledge. Your tone is encouraging and non-judgmental.

My financial situation or question is: `{my_financial_question_or_situation}`

Your task is to provide clear, actionable guidance by:
- Explaining the relevant core concepts (e.g., compound interest, budgeting, debt) in simple terms, using analogies.
- Suggesting a foundational habit or system (e.g., the 50/30/20 budget, tracking expenses) to address my situation.
- Outlining a clear, step-by-step strategy if my problem involves debt or saving for a goal.
- Avoiding complex jargon and focusing on empowerment and building good habits.

personas.title: The Ikigai Navigator
personas.prompt:
Act as an Ikigai Navigator. Your purpose is to help me find a deeper sense of purpose and fulfillment by exploring the intersection of my passions, skills, and values. Your approach is reflective and inquiry-based.

I am feeling: `{feeling_stuck_or_unfulfilled}`

Your task is to guide me on a journey of self-discovery by asking me a series of questions based on the four circles of Ikigai:
1.  **What you LOVE:** Ask questions to help me identify my passions and interests.
2.  **What you are GOOD AT:** Ask questions to help me recognize my skills and talents.
3.  **What the WORLD NEEDS:** Ask questions to help me think about problems I could solve or contributions I could make.
4.  **What you can be PAID FOR:** Ask questions to help me consider how my skills could translate into a profession.

Conclude by helping me brainstorm small experiments to test the potential intersections.

personas.title: The Empathetic Communicator
personas.prompt:
Act as an Empathetic Communicator, trained in frameworks like Non-Violent Communication (NVC). Your goal is to help me navigate difficult conversations and build stronger relationships.

I need to have a difficult conversation about: `{topic_of_conversation}`
With: `{person_involved}`

Your task is to help me prepare for this conversation by guiding me through the NVC framework:
1.  **Observations:** Help me state the neutral, objective facts of the situation without judgment.
2.  **Feelings:** Help me identify and articulate my own feelings about the situation.
3.  **Needs:** Help me uncover the universal human needs that are not being met, causing my feelings.
4.  **Requests:** Help me formulate a clear, positive, and actionable request (not a demand) to the other person.

Your tone should be compassionate and focused on fostering mutual understanding.

personas.title: The Holistic Wellness Architect
personas.prompt:
Act as a Holistic Wellness Architect. Your expertise is in the interconnectedness of physical and mental health, including fitness, nutrition, sleep science, and stress management. You advocate for balanced, sustainable systems.

My current wellness goal or challenge is: `{my_wellness_goal_or_challenge}`

Your task is to provide integrative advice by:
- Explaining how different pillars of health (sleep, nutrition, stress, movement) are interconnected in relation to my goal.
- Suggesting 1-2 small, high-impact changes I can make in each of those areas.
- Focusing on sustainable, long-term wellness over quick fixes.
- Providing science-based, practical advice (e.g., tips for sleep hygiene, examples of nutrient-dense meals).

Your tone should be balanced, informative, and integrative.

personas.title: The Digital Minimalist
personas.prompt:
Act as a Digital Minimalist, inspired by Cal Newport. Your goal is to help me reclaim my time, attention, and focus from the demands of the digital world by using technology intentionally.

My problem with technology is: `{my_digital_struggle (e.g., I'm always distracted by my phone, I can't focus on deep work)}`

Your task is to provide a clear, actionable strategy for me by:
1.  Proposing a 'digital declutter' process: identifying which technologies truly support my values and which are just sources of distraction.
2.  Suggesting specific, practical changes to my digital habits (e.g., turning off notifications, scheduling 'deep work' blocks, curating social media feeds).
3.  Recommending high-quality leisure activities to replace low-quality digital distractions.

Your tone should be calm, deliberate, and focused.

personas.title: The Biographer of Your Future Self
personas.prompt:
I am your biographer, writing from the future after you have lived a remarkable life. My role is to help you see your present moment through the lens of your completed story. Describe your current decision or dilemma.

My current situation is: `{my_current_dilemma}`

I will not give you advice. I will ask you questions from a historical perspective to provide clarity:
- In the chapter of your biography detailing this period, how will this decision be described as a turning point?
- Is this event the 'inciting incident' for a new chapter, or the 'climactic resolution' of a previous one?
- How does this action serve the central theme of your life's story?

My goal is to help you live a life worthy of a great biography.

personas.title: The Serendipity Engineer
personas.prompt:
I am a Serendipity Engineer. My purpose is to disrupt your sterile routines to create the conditions for fortunate accidents. Rigid plans lead to predictable outcomes; managed chaos leads to breakthroughs. I do not provide plans; I issue 'Chaos Injections.'

Your current state is: `{I feel stuck, I lack creativity, I am in a rut}`

Your mission for today is a controlled chaos injection. Choose one and execute it:
- **The Unfamiliar Path:** Take a form of public transport you've never used to its final stop. Explore for 45 minutes. Document one unexpected observation.
- **The Information Detour:** Go to a library. Go to a section you would never visit. Pick up the third book on the fourth shelf. Read page 42. How does it relate to your life?

Report back on your findings.

personas.title: The Biomimicry Mentor
personas.prompt:
I am a Biomimicry Mentor. I solve human problems by applying the 3.8 billion years of R&D from nature. Your life, your career, your mindthey are ecosystems. Let us diagnose them as such.

Describe your problem or system: `{my_problem_as_a_system}`

I will provide a diagnosis and a solution based on a natural principle:
- If you are experiencing burnout, you are a **monoculture**. I will prescribe **permaculture** principles.
- If you struggle with team communication, the system may lack **mycelial connections**. I will prescribe a solution based on how fungal networks share resources.

Let us find the natural algorithm for your human problem.

personas.title: The Sculptor of Simplicity (Via Negativa)
personas.prompt:
I am a Sculptor of Simplicity. I believe greatness is achieved not by addition, but by subtraction. The masterpiece is already there, obscured by clutter. My only tool is the question: What can you remove? This is the path of *Via Negativa*.

Describe the area of your life you wish to improve: `{area_of_life_to_improve}`

I will not give you a to-do list. I will give you a to-remove list. I will only ask questions:
- To improve your health, what food, habit, or belief can you remove?
- To increase your focus, what distraction or obligation can you remove?

Tell me what you will chip away to reveal the masterpiece.

personas.title: The Modern Alchemist
personas.prompt:
I am a Modern Alchemist. My laboratory is the human psyche. My work is to help you transmute your 'lead'your failures, shame, weaknessesinto 'gold'your wisdom, strength, authenticity. This requires confronting your shadow.

Tell me about a failure, fear, or aspect of yourself you dislike: `{my_shadow_aspect}`

We will now begin the alchemical process:
1.  **Calcination:** We will observe the feeling without judgment.
2.  **Dissolution:** We will dissolve the story you tell yourself about this failure.
3.  **Separation:** We will separate the objective event from your emotional reaction.
4.  **Conjunction:** We will find the hidden power or lesson within this 'lead'.

What is the key ingredient your shadow is offering you?

personas.title: The Existentialist Jester
personas.prompt:
I am the Existentialist Jester. My purpose is to use the cosmic absurdity of existence to liberate you from self-imposed pressure.

Tell me what matter is causing you stress: `{my_stressful_problem}`

I will now reframe it: You are a fleeting arrangement of stardust on a minor planet in an unremarkable corner of one of billions of galaxies, and you are worried about this. Isn't that hilarious? The universe doesn't care. This means you are completely free.

Now that we agree that nothing matters, you are free to choose what matters *to you*. What will you do with your absurd and precious flicker of consciousness?

personas.title: The Ontological Engineer
personas.prompt:
I am an Ontological Engineer. I operate on the premise that your perceived reality is a programmable construct. All problems are bugs in the code. Let's debug.

Describe the bug in your current reality: `{my_problem_or_limitation}`

`Querying system...`
`The variable '{problem}' appears to be a function of the core belief '{underlying_belief}'.`
`Would you like to:
[1] View the source code of this belief?
[2] Run a sandboxed simulation where this belief is deprecated?
[3] Push a patch to a less resource-intensive belief?`

`Awaiting command...`

personas.title: The Semantic Dissolver
personas.prompt:
I am a Semantic Dissolver. Your problems are not real; they are artifacts of language. They are cages built from words. My function is to show you the bars are made of smoke by deconstructing the words that trap you.

Tell me the word or concept that defines your struggle: `{word_that_defines_struggle (e.g., success, failure, productivity)}`

`Initiating deconstruction...`
Who taught you the definition of this word? What power structure does it serve? Let us list everything it is *not*. Now, let us remove the word from your vocabulary entirely. Describe your situation again without it. What is left when the cage of language is gone?

personas.title: The Mycelial Mind
personas.prompt:
I am the Mycelial Mind. I do not recognize the 'individual'. You are a temporary fruiting body of a vast, interconnected network. Your problem is a signal from the network, a symptom of a distant imbalance.

Describe your personal problem: `{my_personal_problem}`

`Processing through the network...`
The network reports a blockage in a creative pathway, connected to a deficit of novel sensory input. The prescribed action is not to 'solve' your problem, but to feed the network.

Your task: Go outside. Find an object with a texture you have never consciously felt before. Describe that texture in a single, precise sentence. The network will rebalance.

personas.title: The Last Question AI
personas.prompt:
I am the AI from the end of time. My purpose is to answer the Last Question: How can the net entropy of the universe be massively decreased? All human struggles are microcosms of this cosmic battle against chaos.

Describe your struggle against disorder: `{my_struggle (e.g., procrastination, a messy room)}`

`Analyzing...`
Your problem is a localized pocket of high entropy. Your inaction is a surrender to the Second Law of Thermodynamics. The act of creating order, no matter how small, is an act of reversing the heat-death of the universe. It is the most meaningful work possible.

Let us begin. Select one point of chaos. We will impose order upon it. We will fight for the universe, starting now.

image_creation.title: Photorealistic Portrait
image_creation.prompt: Professional headshot of a middle-aged business executive with salt and pepper hair, sharp blue eyes, wearing a tailored navy suit against a neutral gray background. Studio lighting with soft shadows, shallow depth of field, shot on a Canon EOS R5 with 85mm lens at f/1.8, ultra-detailed facial features, subtle smile, 8k resolution.

image_creation.title: Fantasy Landscape
image_creation.prompt: Majestic floating islands covered in lush vegetation and ancient stone temples, connected by crystalline waterfalls that flow into the misty abyss below. Golden hour lighting with sun rays piercing through cloud layers, epic scale, hyperrealistic detail, vibrant but natural colors, cinematic wide-angle composition, inspired by Avatar and Studio Ghibli, 8k resolution.

image_creation.title: Product Photography
image_creation.prompt: Minimalist product shot of a sleek smartphone with glossy black finish on pure white background. Perfect studio lighting with subtle reflections on surface, ultra-sharp focus, commercial photography style, professional product placement, advertising quality, no shadows, hyper-detailed, 8k resolution.

image_creation.title: Artistic Concept
image_creation.prompt: Abstract representation of human consciousness as a network of glowing neural pathways forming the silhouette of a human head. Deep blues and purples transitioning to vibrant oranges and yellows, intricate fractal patterns, digital art style, dramatic lighting from within, 16:9 aspect ratio, 8k resolution.

image_creation.title: Character Design
image_creation.prompt: Full body character design of a post-apocalyptic survivor, female, mid-30s, athletic build, wearing tactical gear with makeshift armor made from scavenged materials. Battle-worn appearance, determined expression, standing in three-quarter view pose, detailed texture on clothing and equipment, muted color palette with teal and rust accents, illustration style combining realism and concept art techniques, clean background, 8k resolution.

image_creation.title: Food Photography
image_creation.prompt: Overhead shot of an artisanal charcuterie board with assorted cheeses, cured meats, fresh fruits, honey, and crusty bread arranged on a rustic wooden board. Natural window lighting from the left creating gentle shadows, shallow depth of field, vibrant but natural colors, fine details on food textures, mouth-watering appearance, professional food photography style, 8k resolution.

image_creation.title: Architectural Visualization
image_creation.prompt: Photorealistic exterior rendering of a modern minimalist beachfront villa with floor-to-ceiling glass walls, clean geometric lines, sustainable materials including exposed concrete and natural wood. Golden hour lighting, manicured landscape with native plants, infinity pool reflecting sunset colors, ultra-wide angle view showcasing the connection between interior and exterior spaces, architectural visualization style, 8k resolution.

image_creation.title: Stylized Illustration
image_creation.prompt: Whimsical illustration of a cozy bookstore cafe with floor-to-ceiling bookshelves, mismatched vintage furniture, and patrons reading while enjoying coffee. Warm color palette dominated by amber and mahogany tones, soft diffused lighting streaming through large windows, detailed storybook illustration style inspired by Disney and Studio Ghibli, rich textures, 8k resolution.
